author: @amanda-fq7up
text: I’m only halfway through the video. I’m not really educated in political theory, but I have very a basic understanding because of AP history classes in HS. What you’re saying makes way more historical sense than his claim. Also you’re a great explainer. Have you ever thought of becoming a teacher or professor?

author: @SgtCandy
text:
I know all the autonomous zones created last year reminded me a lot of the Bagaudae, which were a series of insurgent peasant/urban communities in the mid-late Roman Empire as peoples began decoupling themselves from the Roman Empire as it became more and more tyrannical to fund all the civil and foreign wars that were happening.

Also why speculate about the US falling like Rome did when that implies talking about the Late Roman Empire where this is basically just the transition from the Republic to the Principate Empire?

author: @necrolyte977
text: Please enter the political sphere man. we need actual leftists in the government and you’ve got the charisma to make it work.
